intro: Polyadenia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered polyadenia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
